abstract: Which one, C.C. Sabathia or Jose Reyes, seems to be the safer bet for a six-year deal? Or does neither?
snippet: Which one, C.C. Sabathia or Jose Reyes, seems to be the safer bet for a six-year deal? Or does neither?
lead_paragraph: C.C. Sabathia's seven-year contract has four years remaining at $23 million a year and an opt-out clause that he can exercise after this season, which would make him a free agent. Assuming Sabathia, a left-handed starter, will use the clause to leverage a better deal from the Yankees, which is the riskier investment:

headline.main: What's the Safer Signing, Sabathia or Reyes?
